creator: jreynolds@lane15.com
text:
Using Tomcat 3.2.3,  If you attempt to specify attributes of the jsp:plugin 
tags with scriptlets, they will not be expanded.

For example, when the following jsp code is converted, the "classname" 
and "archive" expressions are not evaluated:

<jsp:plugin 
     type="applet" 
     code="<%=className%>" 
     archive="<%=archive%>" 
     jreversion="1.2"
     width="650" 
     height="450" >
<jsp:params>
</jsp:params>
<jsp:fallback>
  Plugin not supported
</jsp:fallback>
</jsp:plugin>

Produced the following HTML....


  <OBJECT classid="clsid:8AD9C840-044E-11D1-B3E9-00805F499D93" width="650"  
height="450"  codebase="http://java.sun.com/products/plugin/1.2.2/jinstall-
1_2_2-win.cab#Version=1,2,2,0">
<PARAM name="java_code" value="<%=className%>">
<PARAM name="java_archive" value="<%=archive%>">
<PARAM name="type" value="application/x-java-applet;version=1.2">
<COMMENT>
<EMBED type="application/x-java-applet;version=1.2"  width="650"  height="450" 
pluginspage="http://java.sun.com/products/plugin/" java_code="<%=className%>" 
java_archive="<%=archive%>">
<NOEMBED>
</COMMENT>
Plugin not supported  #CCCCCC
                
</NOEMBED></EMBED>
</OBJECT>

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 2670 ***
